alert.note: Alert for Harrison (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 9:28PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from prior rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following county, Harrison. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 911 PM EST, the stream gauge along the West Fork River in Enterprise indicates minor flooding is occurring due to runoff from earlier rains. - The river level should continue to slowly fall over the next few hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shinnston, Lumberport and Enterprise. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
